Pre-Game Insights: England and Brazil are set to face off in a friendly match at Wembley Stadium on March 23, 2024.
Gareth Southgate's men are preparing for Euro 2024, while Brazil is aiming to snap a demoralizing sequence of results under new head coach Dorival Junior.
England finished first in their Euro 2024 qualifying section, with two victories over Italy and a pair of draws with Ukraine and North Macedonia.
Brazil, on the other hand, has struggled in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers, losing to Uruguay, Colombia, and Argentina in their last three matches.
This friendly match represents a prime opportunity for Brazil to revert to their usual form and potentially decrease national morale further ahead of the 2024 Copa America.
